title: Magnetism - sum forces on moving charged particle

content.description: In Scenario <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, a positively charged particle is moving to the right with initial speed <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>v</mi> <mn>0</mn> </msub> </math> when it enters a region with uniform magnetic and electric fields, as shown. The magnetic field has magnitude <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> and is directed out of the page, and the electric field has magnitude <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi></math> and is directed toward the top of the page. The particle continues moving in a straight line through the region. In Scenario <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> (not shown), the magnitude of the magnetic field is <math alttext="2 B" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>B</mi></math>, and the same particle begins with speed <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> and again continues moving in a straight line through the region.
content.question: What must the magnitude of the electric field be in Scenario <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> </math>?
